page.title: 07Rail Transport Near Yeovil.
page.content: {British Rail transport. Pen Mill {Station.}On Saturday, twenty trains come into the station. On weekdays eighteen trains come into the station. Two freight trains come in a day. They carry stone and sometimes milk. The station is in the{Western {Region.}The station is the busiest at approximately 11:05a.m. A normal ticket man works from, 12:00p.m to 5:00p.m. The station was built in 1830.The line to{Yeovil Junction}was once a main line to the South West and the North for freight.The first train came through the station in 1835.Later, in 1842 the first reigning monarch travelled on a train.The first signal box to be built was one that was initially owned by the Government. The inside was owned by the Canadians.One freight train equals up to 172 lorry loads.
